passages.text: Technology | IT Hardware & Networking
Motorola Solutions, Inc.
MSI| \(\) 469.77\(Outperform | Target Price / Base Case:\) \ \(525.00\) (from \(\) 500.00)
Market Capitalization (M)$79,353Shares Outstanding (M)169Float (M)166Average 10-Day Volume (M)973Enterprise Value (M)$83,87852-Week Range$388.90 - $507.82Fiscal Year EndDec
1 Year Price History

ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW: We had the opportunity to meet with several executives from MSI's management team including CEO Greg Brown, CFO Jason Winkler, Jack Molloy (COO), Uygar Gazioglu (SVP - Treasurer, Tax & IR), and Tim Yocum/Vicki Tzolov from Investor Relations at their HQ. During the event, MSI discussed attractive opportunities for the company presented by the recent \(\) 4.4B\(acquisition of Silvus (which was completed earlier this month), strong demand/budget backdrop across public sector customers (and potential tailwinds form OBBBA), product innovation - led growth across all three technologies, margin expansion levers (despite tariff headwinds), and M&A framework among other topics. We walked away from the meetings with incremental confidence in overall and demand fundamentals and MSI's ability to accelerate product orders growth in H2 (these were two key concerns for investors). More importantly, the meetings reinforced our view that Silvus will be a transformative asset for MSI that will provide the company with a more entrenched position in the defense vertical. Sticking with OP rating and raising target to\) \ \(525\) to reflect our more positive stance on the company's NT and LT growth prospects within their core businesses and Silvus.

"FIVE" Key Points: 1) Silvus is a Transformational Asset: We view Silvus as a transformational asset - the target's technology leadership and critical role in the operation of unmanned aerial vehicles (\\$3B TAM growing to \(\) 7B\(in 3 - 4 years) provides MSI with access to a large and rapidly growing defense - related spend pool. Although the deal is strategic in nature, we are equally impressed with Silvus' financial contribution to MSI's growth profile (\) 475M in revenue - expected to grow 20% in CY26) and EPS accretion (neutral in partial year for 2025 but accretive by - \(\) 0.20\(next year despite investments in go - to - market, R&D, government affairs, etc.). 2) Demand/Budget Backdrop Remains Strong Despite Concern Surrounding Public Sector Spending: At a state and local level, management indicated that budgets tied to public safety continue to be positive. At the federal DoD level, management called out a - 12% y/y increase in spending and 18% increase in procurement. Lastly, the recent passing of OBBBA should also create incremental tailwinds. 3) Attractive Innovation- Driven Growth: While end market fundamentals remain strong, it is important to note that growth is also being driven by MSI's innovation across their portfolio. Within LMR, LTE capabilities on the APX NEXT radios provide MSI with opportunities to monetize additional software applications on the device. The recently introduced SVX body-worn assistant also provides strong software attach opportunities with the added benefit of potentially displacing incumbent BWC vendors (when contracts renew). AI is also being embedded and monetized across Video and Command Center. 4) Confidence in Product Orders Acceleration: Strong pipeline, normalization of buying behavior (post pandemic), new products should drive orders accel. 5) Financial Execution: MSI's focus on margin expansion (despite trade- related impacts) and ability to drive FCF growth > revenue help fuel the company's value- add M&A engine.

Please see the analyst certification and important disclosures on page 6 of this report. Evercore ISI and affiliates do and seek to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.

Demand/Budget Backdrop Remains Strong Despite Concern Surrounding Public Sector Spending: At a state and local level, management indicated that budgets related to public safety continue to be positive. At the federal level, management called out a \(\sim 12\%\) y/y increase in spending and \(18\%\) increase in procurement. Lastly, the recent passing of OBBBA should also create incremental tailwinds.

OBBBA Passing Should Provide Tailwinds: Increased defense/border security spending related to OBBBA should provide MSI with tailwinds (over four years) within their LMR and video businesses. Although it is too early to quantify benefits of this bill, management noted that they could see orders related to OBBBA as early as Q4 of this year. Within LMR, MSI sees potential for increased spending to result in demand for more LMR devices, body- worn cameras, and live translation capabilities offered on their new SVX body- worn AI assistant (SVX can address both BWC and live translation needs). Increased DoD spending is a positive for Silvus. Lastly, there is potential for bonus depreciation of capex to provide some benefits for enterprise video customers.

LMR Provides Mission Critical Communications + Control: Management does not expect technologies such as 5G/6G etc. to displace LMR communications. They highlighted the importance of LMR (better coverage, uptime, capacity, and priority vs. cellular for mission critical communications). LMR also allows customers to own their own networks which provides them with more control vs. relying on other networks. Although MSI customers own their own LMR networks, the company does monetize/make use of existing LTE infrastructure by integrating other capabilities (LTE, apps) onto LMR devices.

APX NEXT Tailwinds for LMR: Currently, APX NEXT accounts for \(\sim 25\%\) of new LMR device orders. From a pricing perspective, the devices carry a high single- digits ASP increase vs. the predecessor premium LMR device. More importantly, MSI can drive further monetization with app subscription revenue ( \(\sim\) \(300 / yr\) per device on average). Customers will need APX Next devices to fully utilize features SVX provides. APX NEXT will also provide the LTE connectivity needed for the BWC function of the SVX. MSI has also introduced a LMR device that integrates TETRA with LTE (Europe version of APX NEXT).

SVX Provides Opportunity to Expand BWC Share in North America: SVX converges a RSM, BWC, and body- worn AI- assistant into a single, first of its kind device. The product is unique in the sense that it can be used as a standalone RSM, as a standalone BWC, or as a converged product and is priced similarly to premium RSM devices. SVX provides several tangible benefits for customers including lower TCO ( \(15\%\) or more), \(\sim 55\%\) weight savings (no need for separate RSM and BWC), audio capabilities (ability to record two tracks of audio: voice isolated audio with higher transcription accuracy and with ambient noise), translation capabilities, and most importantly, integration with Assist (a host of capabilities including live radio transcription/keyword flagging, incident creation, ability to link incidents, tagging BWC video, voice command, integration with RMS, etc.). We see SVX providing notable tailwinds including APX NEXT upgrades (need APX NEXT to fully benefit from SVX), potential to gain BWC share in North America when competitor contracts are up for renewal, and attach of Assist/Command Center solutions (potential for more services attach vs. APX NEXT).

Network Infrastructure Refresh Opportunity with New D- Series Base Stations: MSI recently introduced their new D- Series LMR base station (first base station product in 12 years). The new LMR infrastructure product features improved energy efficiency, more robust cybersecurity, remote software upgrades, and greater interoperability using low orbit satellites. So far, the company has disclosed initial orders from St. Louis, Michigan, and Chicago among other cities. D- Series should contribute to orders performance while providing multi- year tailwinds. As customers upgrade their base stations, it also provides MSI with an opportunity to upsell additional software and services.

Silvus Technology Leadership: MSI believes Silvus has a two year technological lead in their MANET compared to competitors. Prior to proceeding with the Silvus acquisition, MSI spoke with Silvus's customers, external consultants, and military contacts which all held the target's platform in high regard. Silvus provides a proven technology with actual use in Silvus. Importantly, MSI highlighted the company's continued iteration/constant improvement of the solution.

Silvus Unmanned Partnerships/Customers: Silvus's technology is used on \(\sim 80\) different drone manufacturers including Anduril and AeroVironment. Under MSI's ownership, Silvus will maintain their "agnosticity" allowing them to target up to 200 unmanned customers globally without being tied to a specific defense prime.

Attractive Accretion from Silvus in CY26 Despite Need to Invest: Silvus currently generates \(\) 475M\(in annual revenue for CY25 should grow\) \sim 20\% \(in 2026 (despite expectations for lower Ukraine - related revenue). The asset is expected to be EPS neutral and\) \sim \$ 0.20 \text{accretive EPS next year despite incremental headcount investments needed to build sales headcount for federal, international go - to - market, government affairs, and R&D organizations. Silvus should benefit from being under the Motorola umbrella and be able to leverage the acquirer's global presence (120 countries) and relationships with defense customers. Currently, Silvus is mostly a product company; MSI sees potential wrap software/services as part of Silvus's offering in the future.

Public Safety Drone Opportunity: Silvus has somewhat limited applications for public safety applications (need spectrum); MSI addresses the drone as first responder opportunity via their partnered with BRINC on the DFR side (has invested in the company) and they have also invested in SkySafe (drone detection/forensics).

Initial Thoughts on CY26: Although management refrained from providing explicit guidance, they shared with us some high level thoughts for CY26. Broadly they hold a favorable view of their positioning headed into next year. Fundamentally, end market dynamics remain positive, new products across their portfolio (APX NEXT, SVX, etc.) should help with growth, and Silvus contributes to their growth momentum as well ( \(475M revenue in CY25 and expected to grow \~20\%\) in 2026 and the growth component within Silvus should add \~1pt of growth to MSI consolidated). Financially, MSI remains focused on driving cash flow growth (cash flow from ops has grown \~mid- teens annually in recent years), drive margin expansion (despite a full year of tariff- related headwinds; MSI will focus on incremental tariff mitigation efforts).

Product Orders Growth Momentum Should Continue in H2: During Q2, MSI product orders grew \(+10\%\) y/y. Based on the company's mid- \(\) 3B\(outlook for ending product backlog exiting CY25 (ex- Silvus), this implies orders acceleration in H2. Management expects product orders momentum to sustain for the balance of CY25 (strong funnel) driven by LMR device refresh, infrastructure refresh, and fixed video (Silvus should contribute to product orders growth as well). They also pointed to a strong pipeline and normalization of buying behavior (post pandemic).

Tariff Mitigation: Management indicated that the tariff related headwinds for CY25 should be \(\sim\) 80M (down from their prior \(\sim\) 100M view a quarter ago). Despite these headwinds they expect both gross and operating margin to expand for the year. The \(\) 80M\(impact reflects a partial year of headwinds therefore a full year of tariffs next year should result in incremental headwinds next year. Management remains committed to tariff mitigation efforts (supply chain, pricing, opex discipline).

Margin Expansion: MSI guided to \(\sim 100bps\) of margin expansion for CY25 despite tariff headwinds ( \(\sim\) 80M headwind in CY25). The company expects continued margin expansion to be part of their financial model with room to improve profitability in Software & Services (integration of acquisitions). The mix shift toward S&S should contribute to margins as well. On the product side, the mix shift toward premium LMR devices should also help improve profitability.
Capital Allocation: MSI intends to allocate \(55\%\) of cash flow from ops between share repurchase and/or M&A, \(30\%\) on dividends, and \(15\%\) on capex.

M&A Strategy: Although MSI recently closed their \(\) 4.4B\(Silvus acquisition, the company maintains ample capacity for further acquisitions that are tuck - in in nature. MSI ended Q2 with \~1.3x net leverage (Silvus adds \~1 turn subsequent to quarter close). The company remains engaged with potential targets (more focused on core businesses near - term but also open to assets that are more Silvus - adjacent in the future). They also highlighted their strong track record (of the \~50 or so acquisitions in MSI's history, only a couple of them were less successful vs. expectations). The company is mindful of valuations and potential dilutive impacts of larger deals; they highlighted the importance of driving accretion out of larger acquisitions quickly as in the case of Silvus.

VALUATION METHODOLOGYOur Target Price is based on a price/earnings multiple. We assess future earnings growth, operating margins, free cash flow generation and returns on capital employed when determining whether a company is deserving of higher or lower multiples.
RISKS1) Potential slowdown in public sector spending; 2) Potential for shift toward cellular communications and away from LMR; 3) Competition from emerging vendors; and 4) Regulatory environment.

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:
Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
